left_text: Epistomal suture forming obtuse paraocular lobe (as in Fig. 67-6b); inner hind tibial spur broadest near middle (Fig. 67-5l); basitibial plate poorly deﬁned on anterior edge (preoccipital ridge carinate)
right_text: Epistomal suture forming right-angular or slightly obtuse paraocular lobe (Fig. 67-6c); inner hind tibial spur broadest at basal one-third to one-ﬁfth; basitibial plate well deﬁned on all edges

left_text: Inner hind tibial spur with few short, rounded teeth, basal tooth largest, forming broadest part of spur (Fig. 67-5m); basal area of propodeum strongly granular, striate basally; body length about 5 mm
right_text: Inner hind tibial spur with rounded serrations, basal part broadened and serrate, i.e., not formed from a single tooth; basal area of propodeum not strongly granular; body length usually over 5 mm
